pkgmetadata.longdescription: Landscape Connectivity, Habitat, and Protected Area Networks // Given a landscape resistance surface, creates minimum planar graph (Fall et al. (2007) doi:10.1007/s10021-007-9038-7) and grains of connectivity (Galpern et al. (2012) doi:10.1111/j.1365-294X.2012.05677.x) models that can be used to calculate effective distances for landscape connectivity at multiple scales. Documentation is provided by several vignettes, and a paper (Chubaty, Galpern Doctolero (2020) doi:10.1111/2041-210X.13350).
